title: 108_hr1553
content: The Act may be cited as the "Air Transportation Employees Assistance Act" and includes definitions for various terms. The "Air Transportation Employees Assistance Act" defines an "eligible individual" as someone eligible for temporary extended unemployment compensation based on exhausting regular compensation from qualifying employment with an air carrier. Separation from qualifying employment must be due to reductions in service by an air carrier. The "Air Transportation Employees Assistance Act" defines an "eligible individual" as someone eligible for temporary extended unemployment compensation based on exhausting regular compensation from qualifying employment with an air carrier due to reductions in service, airport closures, or military conflict with Iraq. The act also defines terms like "air carrier," "upstream producer," and "supplier." The term "supplier" refers to a firm that produces component parts or services for another firm. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Labor. The term "terrorist action or security measure" refers to a terrorist attack on the United States on September 11, 2001, or a security measure taken in response to such attack. SEC. 3. Additional temporary extended unemployment benefits for eligible employees. The Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002 shall be applied as if it had been amended in accordance with section 4. SEC. 4. Modifications for program extension. Section 208 of the Act shall be amended to specify applicability. An agreement under this Act applies to weeks of unemployment starting after the agreement is made and ending before December 29, 2003. For individuals with remaining funds in an account established under section 203 as of December 28, 2003, extended unemployment compensation will continue to be paid from those funds if eligibility requirements are met. The Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002 is amended to provide additional weeks of benefits, increasing the maximum number of weeks from 13 to 39 and the maximum amount from 50% to 150%. These amendments are effective as if included in the original enactment. The Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002 is amended to provide additional weeks of benefits, increasing the maximum number of weeks from 13 to 39 and the maximum amount from 50% to 150%. These amendments apply to weeks of unemployment beginning on or after the date of enactment, with special rules for individuals with existing temporary extended unemployment accounts. The Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002 is amended to provide additional weeks of benefits, increasing the maximum number of weeks from 13 to 39 and the maximum amount from 50% to 150%. Any TEUC-X amounts before the enactment date are treated as TEUC amounts. Determinations under section 203(c) are disregarded, and new determinations are made under the amended section 203(c). The Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002 is amended to provide additional weeks of benefits, increasing the maximum number of weeks from 13 to 39 and the maximum amount from 50% to 150%. Determinations are made based on exhaustion of all TEUC-X amounts before the enactment date. The Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002 is amended to provide additional weeks of benefits, increasing the maximum number of weeks from 13 to 39 and the maximum amount from 50% to 150%. Exhaustion had not occurred until the date of enactment.
